content:
Thunderbird 115.14.0esr and Thunder 128.1.0esr Released August 6, 2024 is the most current Releases for Tb 128 ESR and the older Tb 115 ESR.

https://www.thunderbird.net/thunderbird/releases/

In another post /questions/1457931 the screenshot was about the Tb 128.0.1 esr released back on July 18, 2024 when Tb 128.1.0esr released on Aug 6 was the current.

Tb 115.14.0 esr is the most current (alongside Tb 128.1.0 esr) with fixes including security fixes so no action is needed as perhaps NordVPN was actually referring to the previous Tb 115.13.0 esr update. Do note though that Tb 115.15.0 esr in September may be the last update (along with Firefox 115.15.0esr) for the old 115 ESR channels.

As you can see Tb 128.1.0 esr: https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2024-37/

Tb 115.14.0 esr : https://www.mozilla.org/security/advisories/mfsa2024-38/
creator: James

content:
A one-time (app) password shouldn't be necessary if the account uses OAuth2 authentication. AOL settings are:

imap.aol.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address. Same for POP except pop.aol.com, 995.

smtp.aol.com, 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Do you have outlook.office365.com for the incoming and smtp.office365.com for the outgoing? Only those servers offer OAuth2 authentication.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202
creator: sfhowes

content: nevermind. issue went away by itself. i blame MSoft.
creator: pat.g888

content:
Without being able to read Japanese, I think you have to manually enter the settings. Based on this page, I would use these settings:

incoming IMAP server imap.so-net.ne.jp, port 993, SSL/TLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

outgoing SMTP server mail.so-net.ne.jp, port 587, STARTTLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

I think IMAP is a paid service.
creator: sfhowes

content:
In Thunderbird go to Account Settings then Server Settings and change Authentication method from Normal Password to OAuth2.

In the column at the left of the screen click Outgoing Server (SMTP). Click Edit and in the box that comes up change Authentication method to OAuth2.
creator: thepillenwerfer

content: Check the toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets preference in Settings/General/Config. editor. If it's true, css files are applied, i.e. tag background colour.

content: Right-click an address book, Export..., Save as type, vCard (*.vcf). To export single contacts as vCards, use the CardBook add-on.

content:
This usually works: Exit Thunderbird if running. 

   click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

content: In TB 128, the colour of buttons and other items is taken from the Windows Settings accent colour, if the TB theme is the system theme. Switch to the light theme to apply standard TB colours.
creator: sfhowes

content: Set View/Headers to Normal. Press Alt if the Menu Bar with View is hidden.
creator: sfhowes

content: is the server set to port 587 and Oauth2 and StARTTLS?

content: If the 'quick filter' box is above message list pane, click the icon to its right. If not, then click View>layout and tick 'message list header' and then use suggestion at beginning of my reply. If menu bar is not visible, press alt key, and then the view>layout and then look for the quick filter box. Whew!

content:
The most current Thunderbird 115 ESR is Tb 115.14.0 esr. The updates are for stability and security fixes, something the older 115.12.2esr is behind on.

Thunderbird 115.14.0.dmg https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.14.0/mac/en-US/ other language locales https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.14.0/mac/

Note unless you can update your macOS to 10.15 (ten.fifteen) or later the most version recent version of Thunderbird and Firefox you can run is 115.14.0 esr and 115.15.0esr in early September may be the last unless they get extended support updates. The 116.0 or later requires macOS 10.15 (ten.fifteen) or later.

Article is for Firefox though the versions apply for Thunderbird also. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-users-macos-1012-1013-1014-moving-to-extended-support
creator: James
